carst.options module¶

class carst.options.CarstOptions(ini_type: carst.options.initialisation_method, *args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: collections.UserDict

__init__(ini_type: carst.options.initialisation_method, *args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Initialise the carst.options.CarstOptions module.

If ini_type is carst.options.initialisation_method.raw_values, args should contain:

  • The base mesh on which the model will operate, of type firedrake.mesh.MeshGeometry.

Parameters

  • ini_type (carst.options.initialisation_method) – The method to use for gathering data.

  • args (Iterable) – Only used if if ini_type is carst.options.initialisation_method.raw_values.

Returns

The processed carst.options.CarstModel instance.

class carst.options.initialisation_method[source]¶

Bases: enum.Enum

Enum for specifying to carst.options.CarstOptions where you want the initialisation data to come from.

diamond_default = 2¶
raw_values = 1¶

carst.solver module¶

class carst.solver.CarstModel(options: carst.options.CarstOptions)[source]¶

Bases: object

Simulates sediment formation on the seabed.

__init__(options: carst.options.CarstOptions)[source]¶

Initialise CarstModel instance.

Parameters

options (carst.options.CarstOptions) – The CarstOptions instance whose information you want to use to initialise the model.

Raise

TypeError if options is not of type CarstOptions.

Returns

The initialised CarstModel instance.

Return type

carst.solver.CarstModel

advance()[source]¶

Advance the simulation by a single time step.

property coordinate_space¶
Returns

The firedrake object describing the coordinate space the model is operating in.

firedrake.ufl.geometry.SpacialCoordinate

property funcs¶
Returns

The FunctionContainer object which holds the current status of all the mathematical functions the model is using.
